title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6659.8 - Reimbursable items
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6659.8 - Reimbursable items

State Regulations

Reimbursable expenses for a recreation program may include
but are not limited to the following examples: (a) compensation for salary paid to one or
more of employees for the purpose of administering the program; (b) compensation for speakers or
consultants; (c) rental costs for
program facilities; (d) utilities
and janitorial costs associated with program facilities; (e) supplies needed for program
operations; (f) equipment needed
for program operations; (g) printing and copying costs; (h) telephone costs; (i) group bus
trips which do not involve overnight lodging; (j) advertising and public information costs
to promote the program; (k) refreshments which are incidental to program activities; and
(l) travel expenses by program leaders and
which are related to program purposes. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
6659.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
